poem:
### The Great Mirage

In the sand's muscle memory,  
where water was a whispering oracle,  
a golden fleet dreams of palm-lined shores.  
The compass spins—wealth, power, exile.  
History's tide, a salty coat,  
turns loyalists to driftwood.  
Boundaries blur in the midday haze—  
a riviera imagined, its echoes swallowed  
by sighs of shifting dunes.
